benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: GET /1.0/kb/customFields/search/{searchKey} - Search custom fields

covered: Valid Request: Happy path with required path parameter and successful 200 responses (TC01).
Pagination: limit/offset behavior and common edge-cases are exercised (TC02, TC07, TC08, TC09, TC28).
Audit parameter handling: FULL, MINIMAL, NONE and combinations with pagination are covered (TC03, TC04, TC05, TC28, TC29).
Query parameter validation: malformed, negative, and unsupported parameters are tested (TC10-TC14).
Empty response handling: scenarios for no matches and offset beyond records are present (TC06, TC09).
Authorization negative tests: missing and invalid authentication token cases are included (TC15, TC16).
Error scenarios: backend unavailable and unsupported HTTP method are included (TC17, TC30).
Input validation & security: XSS/injection, whitespace, empty, long, and Unicode searchKey inputs are tested (TC18, TC21, TC25, TC26, TC27).
Performance & concurrency: stress and concurrent-request scenarios present (TC19, TC20).
Backward-compatibility, integration and documentation checks are present (TC22, TC23, TC24).
Default-parameter flows: default-value scenario explicitly covered and default-path exercised (TC29 and implicit in TC01).
Response shape: multiple scenarios assert that the body is a JSON array of CustomField objects matching the search key (TC01, TC02, many others).
gaps: Caching behavior not tested: no assertions for ETag, Cache-Control, Last-Modified or other caching headers.
Rate limiting and throttling are not covered (no tests for 429 or request throttling under high load).
Response headers and content-type are not asserted (no explicit check for Content-Type: application/json).
Schema validation is missing: returned objects are not validated against the CustomField JSON schema (#/definitions/CustomField).
Authorization scope/permission (403 Forbidden) scenarios are not covered — only missing/invalid token (401) is tested.
Server-side failure modes (500 Internal Server Error, DB failures) are not explicitly simulated/tested — only 503 service unavailable is present.
Ambiguous expectations for empty/whitespace-only searchKey: tests allow 200 or 400 rather than asserting a single business rule.
Path/URL-encoding edge-cases (reserved characters, embedded slashes, percent-encoding) are not explicitly tested.
Integer overflow/out-of-range numeric values for limit/offset (beyond int64) are not tested.
No explicit tests to confirm server-enforced maximum limit cap or behavior when requested limit exceeds allowed maximum.
Accept header / content negotiation behavior is not validated.
Error response format consistency (error payload schema, fields like code/message) is not validated across scenarios.
recommendations: Add tests to assert Content-Type header equals application/json for successful responses and error responses where applicable.
Validate response JSON against the CustomField schema for success scenarios (field presence, types, and required properties).
Add caching tests: repeated requests, conditional GETs with ETag/If-None-Match, and validate Cache-Control/Expires headers and proper 304 handling.
Introduce rate-limiting tests that fire many requests in a short window and assert 429 or configured throttling behavior and backoff guidance.
Add authorization/permission tests that exercise 403 Forbidden for authenticated users without sufficient privileges (role/ACL scenarios).
Simulate server/database failures to verify 500 Internal Server Error handling, error payload consistency, and graceful degradation or retries.
Clarify the business rule for empty or whitespace-only searchKey and convert ambiguous tests into deterministic assertions (either reject with 400 or accept and return results).
Add tests for URL-encoding/decoding edge-cases in searchKey (embedded slashes, percent-encoded sequences, reserved characters) to ensure correct routing and matching.
Test numeric edge cases for limit/offset, including extremely large values (beyond int64) and ensure the API returns 400 or handles them safely.
Define and test maximum allowed limit (server cap) behavior and add assertions that defaults are enforced explicitly (limit=100, offset=0, audit=NONE) when omitted.
Add Accept header and content-negotiation tests to validate responses when different Accept values are provided.
Standardize and assert error response schema across all error cases (400/401/403/404/429/500/503) so clients can rely on consistent error fields and messages.
